intro: Grias, commonly known as the "sacred plant" in certain indigenous cultures, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has thick, waxy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Grias is often found in moist, shaded areas and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important species for both traditional medicine and biodiversity.
